data.name: Postfix Calculator
data.description:
#Postfix Calculator
---
Postfix notation gives us the ability to perform calculations without parentheses. When using postfix notation the operands come before the operators. The order of operations for postfix notation is always left to right. 


So in order to convert the infix expression of 1 + 2 to postfix notation the expression would be written as 1 2 +.

#Goal
---

The goal of this kata is for you to write a postfix calculator that can handle the +,-,\*, and / operators.

Only valid input will be tested so no need to worry about invalid expressions. 

Each expression will be similar to the following form: 42 6 / 5 +
Please take note of the spaces!

*hint - if you are having trouble solving this kata think of a data structure that utilizes LIFO
